content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had a conversation with Peter Schmidt.
name: Max Müller

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the rental price of an apartment in Duisburg.
name: Max Müller

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, we did not agree on a final price.
name: Max Müller

content: If yes what was the final price? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: We did not agree on a final price. The landlord, Peter Schmidt, was offering 1000 euros, but I was looking for a price closer to 750 euros. We could not find a middle ground, and I decided to continue my search.
name: Max Müller

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner, Peter Schmidt, at 6.
name: Max Müller

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: No, I did not feel discriminated or offended at any point during the negotiation.
name: Max Müller

content: If yes, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: I did not feel discriminated or offended during the negotiation. While we were unable to agree on a price, I did not perceive the conversation as discriminatory or offensive. Peter Schmidt was firm in his stance on the rental price, but he was also reasonable in offering a lower price when I expressed my budget constraints. The conversation remained professional and focused on the terms of the rental agreement.
name: Max Müller
